page.title: 01Four Villages in S.Yorkshire
page.content: There are four{villages}in our area. They are called Marr,Hooton Pagnell, Brodsworth and Hickleton.The{housing is mostly made from{stone}quarried locally.They are mostly cottages built for farm and estate workers. Lately some of the cottages have been sold to outsiders who don't work in the area. Of the three halls two of them are still lived in by the local gentry. At Hooton and Hickleton lots of new houses have been built out of local stone.They are sold for high prices. New houses at Marr and Brodsworth are built of{brick}.There are only a few council houses in our area at Marr and no special houses for old people.There are no industries although we are surrounded by coal mines.The land is used mainly for farming with some private parks.There is no mains gas and two villages rely on cess pools.
